Do you have what it takes to name two of our newest members of the library?

post_text:
Middle School Cheerleading!!!
Any 7th and 8th grade student interested in Middle School Cheer for the 2020-2021 Basketball season!!! An all day clinic and Tryout will be held on Saturday, August 22nd from 9am to 3pm at the Dixon Middle School Gym. Please bring a water bottle and a sack lunch. School dress code applies and wear gym shoes. Participants must have a physical on file at the Middle School. Please contact the Middle School office between now and Aug 21st from 8 to 3, with the name of student interested in attending the Cheer clinic, at 573-759-7163 ex 3. We at DMS are excited about this season and hope to see you there!!
text:
Middle School Cheerleading!!!

School dress code applies and wear gym shoes. Participants must have a physical on file at the Middle School. Please contact the Middle School office between now and Aug 21st from 8 to 3, with the name of student interested in attending the Cheer clinic, at 573-759-7163 ex 3. We at DMS are excited about this season and hope to see you there!!

shared_text:
Niki Bascomb is with Mike Plummer and 6 others.
March 31 at 9:15 PM Â·

Today the SERVE Leaders were unable to participate in the district in town parade so with the help of Lisa Miller n Becky Rivera, we were able to go out to do a check in from the vehicles to see how our SERVE members were doing. Although, not all members were home, those that were, greeted us with big smiles and lots of "we miss you's". WE MISS THIS AMAZING GROUP OF KIDDOS! We couldn't have been more blessed for them to have us as their leaders. Stay strong and remember you're not alone! #werefamily #serverocks

Niki Bascomb is with Mike Plummer and 6 others.

We couldn't have been more blessed for them to have us as their leaders. Stay strong and remember you're not alone! #werefamily #serverocks

post_text: Parents/Guardians, I want you to know how amazing I think you are all doing. I know this is challenging with internet issues, sleepy headed students, cabin fever, and a rainy day. Please remember to take a deep breath and reboot if you have to. I have been in the office at the MS for the past two days fielding questions and doing my very best. I wanted to send a note to our MS family's to let you know I am cheering you on. One day at a time and know we will get through this together. I am here for you. Ms Tara :)

Dixon Middle School school store (The Dawg House) and teacher conference room is finished. We had planned to have a grand opening but with the extended spring break, I'd thought I would share. Thank you Mike Plummer for being a great team player and helping to knock this out. Also, thank you to Jeff Brown and Sierra D. Wright, James McClendon, and Sean Sirett for helping us.

This was truly one of my favorite projects to date!

post_text:
Serve worked on deep cleaning the teachers workroom fridge. They added reuseable lables for teachers to use to label their food along with a dry erase board to leave important messages on.

Sam Blase and Jade Studdard were interviewed for an upcoming promotion video for the Missouri Afterschool Network. We are excited to see how this turns out!

Serve deep cleaned the gym bleachers, the stairways, as well as some teachers classrooms. Ty Weed and Jessie Bodenhumer helped collect all the recycling for Ms. Trumps program.

Serve Team was excited to have a new student, Ella Parvin joined us today!

shared_text:
Missouri AfterSchool Network
February 20 at 4:14 PM Â·

A huge THANK YOU to all that were able to attend our Second Annual Show Me Afterschool Day at the Capitol! It was a FANTASTIC day to share the good news of afterschool around the state. We are grateful to all the legislators who gave us office time, hallway time, introductions on the floor and stopped by our exhibits in the Rotunda. Thanks to all the programs that brought afterschool youth and showcased their programs with their exhibits! We canâ€™t wait to begin work for our Third Annual in 2021! Please tag your program and any legislators you met with!!
#ShowMeAfterschool #MOLEG

shared_text:
Niki Bascomb is feeling blessed.
February 28 at 7:25 AM Â·

Cant help but become teary eyed when recieving such a sweet card from the DMS SERVE TEAM. These kids show me everyday why I do what I do. They inspire me to be better.

This week, our kids came up with "Pay it Forward Serve Style" where they pick one person each week to give a helping hand or to express a kind word to help lift someone up. I think the kids just served me with a dose of this. I HAVE BEEN SERVED, SERVE STYLE!

Mike Plummer and I have the best kids hand down. I cant wait to wear my smile all day today!

post_text:
Dixon High School's Helping Dixon Community Club and Dawg Pound will host a Parent Roundtable regarding social media and our students.

The students will present on Social Media Safety, such as hidden apps for parents to watch for, what common apps are capable of, etc. We will also have guests explaining laws regarding social media usage and its effects.

Please RSVP to Mrs. Chelsea Johnson at the information in the pics below to save your spot.
text:

post_text:
Fundraiser Extended!!!
The Dixon Middle School Student Council has been sponsoring a school wide fundraiser. Students are selling 2 pound tubs of cookie dough for $14. This Yummy scoop-able and pre-portioned cookie dough comes in the following flavors: Caramel Pecan Chocolate Chip, Snicker doodle, White Chocolate Macadamia, M&M Candies, Sugar, Oatmeal Raisin, Peanut Butter and Chunky Chocolate Chip. The Student Council and DMS are working very diligently to earn funds to add air conditioning to our gymnasium. If you can help in any way, please see any middle school student to purchase the cookie dough.
Cookie Dough will be on sale until October 18, 2019.

post_text: Cow Days is coming up quickly. This is always an exciting day for the kids. For those of you that allow your student to walk to Cow Days after early release, the DMS Cow Days Transportation Change Form will be sent home on Monday. Please fill this form out and send it back by Wednesday. Your student will not be allowed to walk to Cow Days without a Cow Days Transportation Change form. This is for the safety of all the students. Thank you.

post_text: Congratulations to our candidates for the 2019 Fall Festival Prince and Princess. 8th Grade- Ean Sharp and Kalie Marr, 7th Grade- Kenan Velazquez and Ella Parvin, 6th Grade- Chris Elliott and Abigail Scott. voting has begun and it is a penny a vote. You can bring your extra change to the MS Office to put in your favorite candidates container. The containers will be available for students to vote before school and at lunch. The voting containers will be set up on Friday Sept. 20th at the Chamber booth.

post_text:
Here at the Middle School we have an elevator that we use sometimes for students. It is not the most appealing place to spend time, even though it is for just a few minutes during the day. Our sweet Para Niki Bascomb and her family and friends have sponsored a project to give the elevator shaft a "Powerful" makeover. On behalf of the Dixon Middle School Thank you sooooo much for your hard work and donations to make over this area.

Thank You!

Nichole and Gregory Bascomb- Dixon, Mo
Johannes and Lisa Hiereth- Germany
Harold Mayfield- Virginia
Jonathan Evans- St. Louis, Mo
Kashia Christesen- Fort Leonard Wood, Mo
text:
Here at the Middle School we have an elevator that we use sometimes for students. It is not the most appealing place to spend time, even though it is for just a few minutes during the day. Our sweet Para Niki Bascomb and her family and friends have sponsored a project to give the elevator shaft a "Powerful" makeover. On behalf of the Dixon Middle School Thank you sooooo much for your hard work and donations to make over this area.

Thank You!

Nichole and Gregory Bascomb- Dixon, Mo
Johannes and Lisa Hiereth- Germany
Harold Mayfield- Virginia
Jonathan Evans- St. Louis, Mo
Kashia Christesen- Fort Leonard Wood, Mo

post_text: NJHS 2019 Coat Drive! The NJHS students are holding a coat drive to help keep some of our DES students warm this winter. If you are interested in helping please send your Brand new or gently used coats. Kids size 4 through Adult Medium. Bring donations or coats to a Middle School basketball game or just to the Middle School Office. If you bring a coat to a home game you will receive a free bag of popcorn from the concessions. Thank you so much for your donation!

post_text:
DROP OFF AND PICK UP STUDENTS:

Parents/Guardians, here's some EXTREMELY important information for you to know about Morning Drop Off and Afternoon Picking Up of Students.

Please do not drop off your child before 7:25 am as staff will not be on duty to supervise students. Use the door by the back parking lot. Students will need to go to the gym or cafeteria if eating breakfast.

Students will be released for pick up at 3:10. Please use a parking space instead of waiting in line so that other vehicles are not causing traffic congestion in the parking lot. Students will exit through the drop off/pick up door by the back parking lot.

The MS boys were the Frisco League Conference Champs. Frisco League MVP- Case Sinden

MS girls took 4th place. Frisco League MVP- Montgomery Keck.

Both boys and girls teams came home with SEVERAL medals and first place wins. Please congratulate them if you see them today. They have worked very hard this season and their Frisco League finishes are well deserved!

post_text: MAP Testing starts the week of April 29 - May 3. One week to go!!! 6th graders will test Wednesday the 1st and Friday the 3rd from 8-11:30. 7th Graders will test Tuesday the 30th and Thursday the 2nd from 8-11:30. 8th Graders rest Tuesday - Friday from 11:30-3:00. If you have any questions, please let me know! Make sure your kids get enough rest that week.

Tuesday 23rd: Ball through the MAP test, dress like an athlete!
Wednesday 24th: Workout your brain, dress in workout clothes!
Thursday 25th: Throwback Thursday, dress like your younger self!
Friday 26th: Relax befoe the test, wear lounge clothes/PJ's
